wikipedia_page.main: Peter Sime Douty (26 October 1903, in Leeds, England – 18 July 1948, in Newton Abbot, Devon) was a Scottish rugby union player.He was a scrum half, and played three times for Scotland, against Wales, Australia and France in the 1927–28 season.He also went on the 1927 British Lions tour to Argentina.
